definition: bubbling with humor (idiom); witty and interesting

sentences.english: But in fact it was McEwan's funniest novel for years.
sentences.chinese: 但是事实上这是他数年来最为风趣的一本著作。

sentences.english: "The Arabian Nights" is a very interesting story-book.
sentences.chinese: “一千零一夜”“是一本极度风趣的故事书。

sentences.english: I graduated from junior high school star, I lively and cheerful character, witty humor.
sentences.chinese: 偶毕业于红星初中，偶哒性格活泼开朗，风趣幽母霈。

sentences.english: Learned before, a table personnel, optimistic, cheerful, witty humor.
sentences.chinese: 博学多才，一表人才，开朗乐观，风趣幽默。

sentences.english: In the stone engraves helps one another in difficult time engraves the completely black humor.
sentences.chinese: 石头上刻的相濡以沫刻尽玄色风趣。

sentences.english: But in fact it was McEwan’s funniest novel for years.
sentences.chinese: 但是事实上这是他数年来最为风趣的一本著作。

sentences.english: Her wit, her voice my heart beguiles.
sentences.chinese: 她的幽默风趣，她的悦耳声音，让我神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: The humor effect states that humorous items are more easily remembered than non-humorous ones.
sentences.chinese: 幽默效应国家风趣项目更容易被记住，比非幽默。

sentences.english: Do you work with people who are full of wit?
sentences.chinese: 你会和机智风趣的人一起工作？

sentences.english: This perticular subject is very fun to me as I want to master a foreign language .
sentences.chinese: 这门课对我来说非常风趣，由于我想要掌握这门外语。

sentences.english: Yet another distinctive, playful font with rounded glyphs.
sentences.chinese: 又是一种独特，风趣的有着圆形的字符的字体。

sentences.english: I hope the next speaker dishes up his arguments in a more interesting manner.
sentences.chinese: 我希望下一个发言人更加饶有风趣地提出他的论点。

sentences.english: For his sense of humour, There are many anecdotes of Qianzhongshu.
sentences.chinese: 由于钱锺书的幽默风趣，有不少关于他的逸闻趣事。

sentences.english: Forget witty chat-up lines and splashing on the aftershave .
sentences.chinese: 忘了那些风趣的搭讪和须后水吧。

sentences.english: He manages to pull off being funny and incredibly endearing at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 他尽量使其扮演的角色风趣同时又非常讨人喜欢。

definition: to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
amiable and approachable (idiom); easy-going/modest and unassuming/(of writing) plain and simple/easy to understand
